text: Renal cell carcinoma - derived gangliosides suppress nuclear factor-kappaB activation in T cells .
Activation of the transcription factor nuclear factor-kappaB ( NFkappaB ) is impaired in T cells from patients with renal cell carcinomas ( RCCs ) .

In circulating T cells from a subset of patients with RCCs , the suppression of NFkappaB binding activity is downstream from the stimulus - induced degradation of the cytoplasmic factor <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: The inhibitory agent has several features characteristic of a ganglioside , including sensitivity to neuraminidase but not protease treatment ; hydrophobicity ; and molecular weight less than 3 kDa .
Indeed , we detected gangliosides in supernatants from RCC explants and not from adjacent normal kidney tissue .

Gangliosides prepared from RCC supernatants , as well as the purified bovine gangliosides G ( m1 ) and G ( d1a ) , suppressed NFkappaB binding activity in T cells and reduced expression of the cytokines <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Taken together , our findings suggest that tumor - derived gangliosides may blunt antitumor immune responses in patients with RCCs .
